reviews.review_msg: Maybe he isn't good at teaching lecture courses, but I thought he was a fine lab professor. He talked too much so it was hard to finish labs in time, but he adapted and pre-recorded his pre-lab talk. Explains things clearly. I hated this course so much because it seems like a waste of 4 hours each week, but he wasn't the reason the course sucked!

Even though this lab course was only a 1 unit course, it felt like 3 units at times. Alberding seems like a really nice guy, but somewhat clueless when it came to his students and teaching. The instructions on the lab were very unclear, leading to a lot of extra time and effort deciphering what was required, with little clarification from him.
Solid choice for a Physics lab :) enjoyed the course, it was hard but rewarding.

He's kind of intimidating; I felt a bit judged when our group did something wrong sometimes. Honestly, the TAs are more helpful than him during the labs. However, with using the software he was helpful and sometimes will hint answers. I would only take his course for PHYS132 since it is an easier course.
